00039

00087   ######################################################################
00088   # Returns the loaded preference values for the given session name and
00089   # language.
00090   proc get_loaded {{session ""} {language ""}} {
00091 
00092     variable loaded_prefs
00093 
00094     # If the session has not been previously loaded, attempt to do it now
00095     if {($session ne "") && ![info exists loaded_prefs(session,$session,global)]} {
00096       sessions::load_prefs $session
00097     }
00098 
00099     # Figure out key prefix
00100     if {($session eq "") || ![info exists loaded_prefs(session,$session,global)]} {
00101       set prefix "user"
00102     } else {
00103       set prefix "session,$session"
00104       array set lprefs $loaded_prefs(user,global)
00105     }
00106 
00107     array set lprefs $loaded_prefs($prefix,global)
00108 
00109     if {($language ne "") && [info exists loaded_prefs($prefix,$language)]} {
00110       array set lprefs $loaded_prefs($prefix,$language)
00111     }
00112 
00113     return [array get lprefs]
00114 
00115   }

00117   ######################################################################
00118   # Called whenever the current text is changed.  Reloads the preferences
00119   # based on the given set of preferences.
00120   proc update_prefs {{session ""}} {
00121 
00122     variable loaded_prefs
00123     variable prefs
00124 
00125     # Calculate the preference prefix
00126     if {($session ne "") && [info exists loaded_prefs(session,$session,global)]} {
00127       set prefix "session,$session"
00128     } else {
00129       set prefix "user"
00130     }
00131 
00132     array set temp_prefs $loaded_prefs($prefix,global)
00133 
00134     # Load language-specific preferences, if necessary
00135     if {([set txt [gui::current_txt]] ne "") && \
00136         ([set language [syntax::get_language $txt]] ne [msgcat::mc "None"]) && \
00137         [info exists loaded_prefs($prefix,$language)]} {
00138       array set temp_prefs $loaded_prefs($prefix,$language)
00139     }
00140 
00141     # Remove any preferences that have not changed value
00142     foreach {name value} [array get temp_prefs] {
00143       if {[info exists prefs($name)] && ($prefs($name) eq $temp_prefs($name))} {
00144         unset temp_prefs($name)
00145       }
00146     }
00147 
00148     # Set the preferences
00149     array set prefs [array get temp_prefs]
00150 
00151   }

00153   ######################################################################
00154   # Loads the base preferences information, sorting out the comments from
00155   # the preferences information and storing this information in the
00156   # namespace base_prefs and base_comments arrays.
00157   proc load_base_prefs {} {
00158 
00159     variable base_preference_file
00160     variable base_prefs
00161     variable base_comments
00162 
00163     # Only load the base preferences information if we have previously done so
00164     if {[array size base_prefs] == 0} {
00165 
00166       # Read the base preferences file (sort out comments from preferences)
00167       if {![catch { tkedat::read $base_preference_file } rc]} {
00168         foreach {key value} $rc {
00169           if {[lassign [split $key ,] opt] eq "comment"} {
00170             set base_comments($opt) $value
00171           } else {
00172             set base_prefs($opt) $value
00173           }
00174         }
00175       }
00176 
00177     }
00178 
00179   }

00190   ######################################################################
00191   # Save the preference array to the preferences file.
00192   proc save_prefs {session language data} {
00193 
00194     variable loaded_prefs
00195     variable prefs
00196     variable preferences_dir
00197 
00198     if {$session eq ""} {
00199 
00200       # Get the filename to write and update the appropriate loaded_prefs array
00201       if {$language eq ""} {
00202         if {[info exists loaded_prefs(user,global)]} {
00203           array set content $loaded_prefs(user,global)
00204         }
00205         array set content $data
00206         set loaded_prefs(user,global) [array get content]
00207         tkedat::write [get_user_preference_file] $loaded_prefs(user,global) 0
00208       } else {
00209         if {[info exists loaded_prefs(user,$language)]} {
00210           array set content $loaded_prefs(user,$language)
00211         }
00212         array set content $data
00213         set loaded_prefs(user,$language) [array get content Editor/*]
00214         lappend loaded_prefs(user,$language) {*}[array get content Documentation/*]
00215         tkedat::write [file join $preferences_dir preferences.$language.tkedat] $loaded_prefs(user,$language) 0
00216       }
00217 
00218     } else {
00219 
00220       # Get the filename to write and update the appropriate loaded_prefs array
00221       if {$language eq ""} {
00222         if {[info exists loaded_prefs(session,$session,global)]} {
00223           array set content $loaded_prefs(session,$session,global)
00224         }
00225         array set content $data
00226         array unset content General/*
00227         array unset content Help/*
00228         array unset content Debug/*
00229         array unset content Tools/Profile*
00230         array unset content Editor/Snippet*
00231         set loaded_prefs(session,$session,global) [array get content]
00232       } else {
00233         if {[info exists loaded_prefs(session,$session,$language)]} {
00234           array set content $loaded_prefs(session,$session,$language)
00235         }
00236         array set content $data
00237         array unset content Editor/Snippet*
00238         set loaded_prefs(session,$session,$language) [array get content Editor/*]
00239       }
00240 
00241       # Save the preference information to the sessions file
00242       sessions::save "prefs" $session
00243 
00244     }
00245 
00246     # Update the UI/environment if the session name matches the current one
00247     if {$session eq [sessions::current]} {
00248 
00249       # Update the UI
00250       update_prefs $session
00251 
00252       # Perform environment variable setting from the General/Variables preference option
00253       utils::set_environment $prefs(General/Variables)
00254 
00255     }
00256

00259   ######################################################################
00260   # Constantly monitors changes to the tke preferences file.
00261   proc load_file {{language ""}} {
00262 
00263     variable base_preference_file
00264     variable loaded_prefs
00265     variable prefs
00266     variable menus
00267     variable base_comments
00268     variable base_prefs
00269     variable preferences_dir
00270 
00271     # Get the user preferences file
00272     set user_preference_file [get_user_preference_file]
00273 
00274     # If the preferences file does not exist, add it from the data directory
00275     if {[file exists $user_preference_file]} {
00276 
00277       # Get the file status information for both the base and user files
00278       file stat $base_preference_file base_stat
00279       file stat $user_preference_file user_stat
00280 
00281       # Read the user preferences file
00282       if {![catch { tkedat::read $user_preference_file 0 } rc]} {
00283         array set user_prefs $rc
00284       }
00285 
00286       # If the base preferences file was changed since the user file has changed, see if the
00287       # user file needs to be updated and update it if necessary
00288       if {$base_stat(ctime) > $user_stat(ctime)} {
00289 
00290         # Read both the base the preferences file (sort out comments from preferences)
00291         load_base_prefs
00292 
00293         # If the preferences are different between the base and user, update the user
00294         if {[lsort [array names base_prefs]] ne [lsort [array names user_prefs]]} {
00295 
00296           # Copy only the members in the user preferences that are in the base preferences
00297           # (omit the comments)
00298           foreach name [array names user_prefs -regexp {^[^,]+$}] {
00299             if {[info exists base_prefs($name)]} {
00300               set base_prefs($name) $user_prefs($name)
00301             }
00302           }
00303 
00304           # Write the base_prefs array to the user preferences file
00305           if {![catch { tkedat::write $user_preference_file [array get base_prefs] 0 } rc]} {
00306             set loaded_prefs(user,global) [array get base_prefs]
00307           }
00308 
00309         # Otherwise, assign the user preferences to the
00310         } else {
00311           set loaded_prefs(user,global) [array get user_prefs]
00312         }
00313 
00314       # Otherwise, just use the user preferences file
00315       } else {
00316         set loaded_prefs(user,global) [array get user_prefs]
00317       }
00318 
00319     } else {
00320 
00321       # Copy the base preferences to the user preferences file
00322       file copy -force $base_preference_file $preferences_dir
00323 
00324       # Read the contents of the user file
00325       if {![catch { tkedat::read $user_preference_file 0 } rc]} {
00326         set loaded_prefs(user,global) $rc
00327       }
00328 
00329     }
00330 
00331     # Read the language preference file
00332     if {$language ne ""} {
00333       set languages $language
00334     } else {
00335       set languages [list]
00336       foreach lang_file [glob -nocomplain -directory $preferences_dir -tails preferences.*.tkedat] {
00337         if {[regexp {preferences\.(.*)\.tkedat} $lang_file -> lang]} {
00338           lappend languages $lang
00339         }
00340       }
00341     }
00342 
00343     # Save off settings from each language
00344     foreach lang $languages {
00345       if {![catch { tkedat::read [file join $preferences_dir preferences.$lang.tkedat] 0 } rc]} {
00346         set loaded_prefs(user,$lang) $rc
00347       }
00348     }
00349 
00350     # Update the preferences
00351     update_prefs
00352 
00353     # Perform environment variable setting from the General/Variables preference option
00354     utils::set_environment $prefs(General/Variables)
00355 
00356   }

00359   # Delete the specified language preference file and reload preferences
00360   # for the given language.
00361   proc delete_language_prefs {session language} {
00362 
00363     variable preferences_dir
00364     variable loaded_prefs
00365 
00366     if {$session eq ""} {
00367       if {[info exists loaded_prefs(user,$language)]} {
00368         unset loaded_prefs(user,$language)
00369       }
00370       file delete -force [file join $preferences_dir preferences.$language.tkedat]
00371     } else {
00372       if {[info exists loaded_prefs(session,$session,$language)]} {
00373         unset loaded_prefs(session,$session,$language)
00374         sessions::save "prefs" $session
00375       }
00376     }
00377 
00378     # Update preferences
00379     update_prefs $session
00380 
00381   }

00384   # Adds the plugin preferences to the existing preference information,
00385   # taking care to not overwrite an existing preference value.
00386   proc add_plugin_prefs {prefs} {
00387 
00388     variable loaded_prefs
00389 
00390     array set plugin_prefs $prefs
00391     array set global_prefs $loaded_prefs(user,global)
00392 
00393     # Clean up the global_prefs array
00394     foreach name [array names global_prefs Plugins/*] {
00395       if {![info exists plugin_prefs($name)]} {
00396         unset global_prefs($name)
00397       } else {
00398         unset plugin_prefs($name)
00399       }
00400     }
00401 
00402     # Add any new plugin preference values
00403     array set global_prefs [array get plugin_prefs]
00404 
00405     # Replace the global user preferences
00406     set loaded_prefs(user,global) [array get global_prefs]
00407 
00408     # Update the global user preferences
00409     update_prefs
00410 
00411   }

00413   ######################################################################
00414   # Loads session information.
00415   proc load_session {name data} {
00416 
00417     variable base_prefs
00418     variable loaded_prefs
00419 
00420     # Make sure that the base preferences are loaded
00421     load_base_prefs
00422 
00423     # Get the session key and data
00424     lassign $data key sdata
00425 
00426     # Initialize with the base preferences (to make sure that we don't allow session preferences to get stale)
00427     set loaded_prefs($key) [array get base_prefs]
00428 
00429     # Override base preferences with user preferences
00430     set loaded_prefs($key) $loaded_prefs(user,global)
00431 
00432     # Set the incoming preference information into the loaded_prefs array
00433     set loaded_prefs($key) $sdata
00434 
00435     # Update the UI
00436     if {$name eq [sessions::current]} {
00437       update_prefs $name
00438     }
00439 
00440   }

00442   ######################################################################
00443   # Save session information.
00444   proc save_session {name} {
00445 
00446     variable loaded_prefs
00447 
00448     if {![info exists loaded_prefs(session,$name,global)]} {
00449       foreach user_type [array names loaded_prefs user,*] {
00450         lassign [split $user_type ,] user type
00451         set loaded_prefs(session,$name,$type) $loaded_prefs($user_type)
00452       }
00453     }
00454 
00455     return [array get loaded_prefs session,$name,*]
00456 
00457   }
